thread.title: Livestock and Grain Traders Navigate Murkier Market

author: Benjamin Parkin
title: Livestock and Grain Traders Navigate Murkier Market
text:
A new way to trade agricultural futures in bulk is raising concerns that markets for the crops and livestock that feed the world are becoming less transparent.
CME Group Inc. since January has allowed hedge funds, grain companies and others to privately trade “blocks” of futures and options for corn, cattle and other agricultural commodities. CME, the world’s largest exchange operator, says bulk deals make big transactions more efficient and facilitate trading in little-used markets.
